bxvufypZ.question:
The cross-feed fuel system can be used to
1. feed any engine from any fuel tank.
2. dump the unusable fuel.
3. adjust fuel distribution
4. to transfer fuel from one tank to another located in the same wing.
 The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is

hwuAk619.question: Should a hydraulic pump seize during operation:

options.text: the quill drive will shear to offload and protect the gearbox.
the freewheel unit will disengage the pump from the gearbox.
the inner barrel of the pump will rotate thus offloading and protecting the gearbox.
a red light will illuminate in the cockpit to warn the pilot of the failure.

AgghzRAc.question:
Annex 021-012-008
Associate the correct legend to each of the numbered images

options.text: 1- cantilever 2- fork 3- half fork 4- dual wheels
1- half-fork 2- single trace 3- cantilever 4- dual wheels
1- half fork 2- fork 3- cantilever 4- tandem
1- cantilever 2- dual wheels 3- half fork 4- fork

Y8atu1GD.question: Which of the following statements is/are correct? - 1. The freezing point for Jet A is at a higher temperature than that for Jet B. - 2. The flash point for Jet A is at a higher temperature than that for Jet B.

options.text: Both 1 and 2 are correct.
Both 1 and 2 are incorrect.
1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.
1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.

QieNB1Mm.question: Which of the following is indicated in the cockpit for the fuel system?

options.text: Fuel quantity.
Tank-sensor location.
Tank pressure.
Refuelling-valve position.

HS2fhLkJ.question: On a jet aeroplane, fuel heaters are:

options.text: located on the engines.
installed in each tank.
installed only in the centre tank.
not necessary at all.

VRo90OR0.question: The purpose of baffle check valves fitted in aircraft fuel tanks is to

options.text: prevent fuel movement to the wing tip.
prevent positive pressure buildup inside the tank.
close the vent lines in case of turbulence.
damp out movement of the fuel in the tank.

Hh4vBTCm.question: During refuelling (pressure refuelling) of a modern passenger transport aeroplane fuel system, which component would prevent the required tank vent space being filled with fuel?

options.text: the automatic fuelling shutoff valve.
the cross-feed valve.
the jettison valve.
the diffuser.

byYx5VKZ.question: The ventilation system in a fuel tank..

options.text: prevents low pressure or excessive overpressure in the tank.
prevents fuel freezing during flight in icing conditions.
prevents vapour locking in the fuel lines.
can be used to drain the tanks, for daily checks.

3jUtjfkF.question: Refer to the annex. Given the system in the annex, the main purpose of the DC fuel pump in the left main tank is to:

options.text: supply fuel to the APU.
supply fuel to both engines in case of total loss of AC power.
enable cross-feeding the right engine from the left main tank.
enable transfer of fuel from the main to the centre tank.
on all transport category aircraft where the Maximum Take-off Weight (MTOW) is significantly higher than the Maximum Landing Weight (MLW).
on all transport category aircraft with more than 150 seats.
on aircraft with a Maximum Take-off Weight (MTOW) higher than 5.7 tons.
on all transport category aircraft.

FlXJa1bz.question:
Refer to figure. 
 Which of these statements about the fuel system in the annex are correct or incorrect?
1. If the AC fuel pumps are not running in the system configuration shown in the annex, it is still possible to feed both engines from the main tanks. 
 2. If the APU isolation valve opens, the APU fuel shut off valve is closed and there is no AC power, the DC fuel pump can supply fuel to the engines.

options.text: 1 is correct, 2 is correct.
1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.
1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.
1 is incorrect, 2 is incorrect.

BNhKqFo3.question: One of the purposes of the fuel system booster pumps being submerged in fuel is to..

options.text: cool the pumps.
shorten the fuel lines, so minimising the pressure losses.
to improve the accuracy of the fuel quantity measurement.
improve their efficiency.

ZHvdwa28.question: An aircraft having "wet wing" fuel storage tanks is equipped with..

options.text: integral fuel tanks.
fuselage fuel tanks.
bladder fuel tanks.
rigid fuel tanks.

ZrEiWfkh.question: On most transport jet aircraft, the low pressure pumps of the fuel system are supplied with electric power of the following type:

options.text: 115 V AC
28 V AC
28 V DC
115 V DC

zpaenx7L.question:
Refer to Annex 021-003 -2008.  
  Given the system in the annex which of these statements about cross feeding is correct?

options.text: Fuel supply is possible from any tank to any main engine.
Fuel supply is possible only from the left main tank to the right main engine.
Cross feeding is not possible when one cross feed valve is closed.
Fuel supply is possible only from the centre tank to any main engine.

4899s36X.question: During fuelling the automatic fuelling shut off valves will switch off the fuel supply system when:

options.text: the fuel has reached a predetermined volume or mass.
fuelling system has reached a certain pressure.
the surge vent tank is filled.
there is fire.
comprise a portion of the aircraft structure, which has been sealed to form a fuel tank.
is the name given to a group of fuel tanks where several tanks feed a master tank which in turn supplies the engine.
is an alternate name for a system of bladder tanks installed within the aircraft structure.
are small fuel tanks fitted on the engine to ensure a positive supply of fuel to the engine driven fuel pump.

A3KVnUp5.question: What is the compensation for in a compensated capacitance fuel gauging system?

options.text: To compensate for changing fuel density associated with the change in local temperature.
To prevent the fuel from reaching its flashpoint in high temperature conditions.
To compensate for the change in fuel reading resulting from aircraft manoeuvres.
For the change in volume associated with the change in local temperature.

Fv9r4GhL.question:
Complete the following statement:
The capacitance type fuel gauging system indicates the fuel quantity by measuring...

options.text: The dielectric change between fuel and air.
The density variation of the fuel.
The electrical resistance change.
The resistivity variation of the fuel.
stops fuelling as soon as a certain fuel level is reached inside the tank.
cuts off the fuel in case of engine fire.
stops fuelling whenever a certain fuel temperature is exceeded.
stops fuelling as soon as the fuel spills into the vent line.

mmjY1vMy.question: The fuel supply system on a jet engine includes a fuel heating device, upstream of the main fuel filter so as to:

options.text: prevent, at low fuel temperature, the risk of ice formation from water contained in the fuel.
maintain and improve fuel heating power.
ease low pressure pumps work by increasing fuel fluidity.
prevent fuel from freezing in fuel pipes due to low temperatures at high altitude.

PWNPjVr8.question: The purpose of baffles fitted in wing fuel tanks is to

options.text: damp fuel movement during sideslip.
prevent positive pressure build-up inside the tank.
close the vent lines in case of turbulence.
limit high fuel flow during refuelling operations.

04blTrwJ.question: Determine the main functions of the fuel system.

options.text: Provision of fuel to the engines, appropriate pressure to enable engine operation
Even distribution of fuel among the tanks
Fuel storage and filtering
Ensuring that the central tank is emptied first

lOEmWEpq.question: Fuel tank air pressure is maintained at ambient by the fuel..

options.text: vent system.
dump system.
top-off unit.
tank drains.

lTBlRTaf.question:
The fuel system has many tasks
Its main task is to

options.text: ensure a steady flow of fuel at a rate and pressure to keep the engine functioning.
store the fuel in one or more independent fuel tanks and prevent fuel surging during manoeuvres.
clean the fuel and remove impurities.
balance the aircraft during flight when fuel is being used.

KAAqgRvb.question: Turbine fuel may contain additives to:

options.text: reduce the risk of ice crystals forming at low temperatures.
enhance combustion temperatures.
increase the viscosity across a larger range of temperatures.
increase the flash point at high temperatures.

akAodHvN.question: The capacitance type fuel gauging system indicates the fuel quantity by measuring the

options.text: dielectric change between fuel and air.
electrical resistance change.
resistivity variation of the fuel.
density variation of the fuel.

hxtqvvnx.question:
Refer to figure 021-22.
If fuel is needed for the APU, from which tank shall fuel be supplied?

options.text: From all tanks.
From the centre tank.
From none of those tanks shown.
From the left tank.

9WbJtZZk.question: The correct order of decreasing freezing points of the three mentioned fuels is

options.text: Jet A, Jet A-1, Jet B.
Jet B, Jet A, Jet A-1.
Jet A-1 Jet A, Jet B.
Jet B, Jet A-1, Jet A.
allows feeding of any engine from any fuel tank.
is only used in flight for fuel transfer from one tank to another.
is only used to feed an engine from a tank in the opposite wing.
is only used on the ground for fuel transfer from one tank to another.

aKh4MM5U.question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding "unusable fuel"?

options.text: Sometimes it can be minimised by the incorporation of tank sump pads.
It is always the same quantity irrespective of aircraft attitude or flight conditions.
It is the amount of fuel not available for use but included on the fuel contents gauge.
It is the fuel which is drained from the aircraft due to water contamination.
in the line between the booster pump and the engine or at the outlet of the high-pressure filter.
in the line between the high-pressure filter and the high-pressure pump.
always at the outlet of the high-pressure pump only.
at the outlet from the fuel control unit.

ayyqmWzL.question:
The image shown in annex represents a jet fuel system
The fuel flow measurement is carried out

options.text: after high pressure valve (item 4).
in the fuel control unit (item 3).
after low pressure valve (item 1).
after high pressure pump first stage (item 2).

QcRHBKSj.question: The types of fuel tanks used on most modern transport aircraft are:

options.text: Integral tanks.
Combined fuel tanks.
Wet cell tanks.
Fixed built-in tanks.

uP3TL4xX.question: The fuel cross-feed system is used to

options.text: feed any engine from any fuel tank.
eliminate unusable fuel from the tanks.
automatically fill every tank up to the pre-selected level.
quickly jettison the fuel in case of emergency.

TwGEgVqZ.question: What is a disadvantage of MOGAS in relation to AVGAS

options.text: higher risk of ice in carburettor
More expensive
Higher risk of becoming wax like and clogging up fuel lines
Can ignite without a spark and cause an explossion

QZq0WIEt.question: In order to ensure that all fuel on board is available to any engine on a large multi-engined aircraft, the fuel system must be fitted with

options.text: a cross-feed valve.
a tank shut-off valve.
a jet pump.
booster pumps.

LpaBQ5gl.question:
Refer to figure 021-23.
The diagram shown in annex represents a jet fuel system. The fuel flow measurement is carried out:

options.text: after high pressure valve (item 4).
after low pressure valve (item 1).
after high pressure pump first stage (item 2).
in the fuel control unit (item 3).
may be fitted in the fuel delivery line between the fuel tank and the engine.
are devices fitted to the engine and heated using engine oil or hot air tapped from the compressor.
are replaced by water traps at the bottom of the fuel tanks on helicopters.
are not required on helicopters due to the inability of the aircraft to fly at high altitude.

LY5WkNQs.question:
Which statement is correct?
1) The freezing point for Jet A is at about the same temperature as that for Jet B.
2) The flash point for Jet A is at a higher temperature than that for Jet B.

options.text: 1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.
1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is correct.

8VAjKABb.question: Fuel tanks are fitted with baffles to

options.text: damp spanwise fuel motion in the tanks.
remove air bubbles from the fuel.
prevent spanwise fuel motion during constant sideslip.

nXCVwWNQ.question: One advantage in the design of integral fuel tanks over other types of fuel tank is that they

options.text: provide the highest volume of fuel storage space.
do not require to be sealed to prevent leakage.
are resistant to microbiological contamination.
do not require a vent system.

VNvZ3pET.question: Select the correct ascending order of fuel freezing points of Jet A, A-1, B...

options.text: Jet B, Jet A-1, Jet A.
Jet A, Jet A-1, Jet B.
Jet A-1 Jet A, Jet B.
Jet B, Jet A, Jet A-1.

qLoArWp7.question: In flight, with the centre tank empty and APU operating, a fuel imbalance is detected where the quantity of fuel in left main tank is less than in right main tank. Rebalancing of the two tanks is

options.text: possible with the crossfeed valves “OPEN”, the left main tank AC pumps “OFF”, and right main tank AC pumps “ON”
impossible without causing the APU to stop.
“possible with the crossfeed valves “OPEN” and right main tank AC pumps “OFF”
impossible because there is no fuel in the centre tank.

pG40qFls.question:
Refer to figure 021-22.
If the DC pump on the left tank is inoperative, how can you feed the left engine with fuel?

options.text: By any AC pump.
By the right AC pumps only.
By the centre AC pumps only.
By the left AC pumps only.

d4NKih1e.question: The fuel system boost pumps are used to

options.text: avoid the bubbles accumulation and feed the lines with fuel for directing it to the engine at a positive pressure.
feed the fuel control units, which inject the pressurized fuel into the engine.
avoid the bubbles accumulation.
feed the lines with fuel for directing it to the engine at a positive pressure.

MMzDgpca.question: To prevent vapour locking, which can lead to fuel starvation, a common type of limitation imposed by the Minimum Equipment List (MEL) in large transport aeroplanes for complete boost pump failure is:

options.text: Maximum operating altitude limitation.
Extra reserve fuel has to be carried.
No fuel may be carried in the affected fuel tank.
Minimum fuel temperature limitation.

DvypKPrt.question: The purpose of baffles in an aeroplane`s wing fuel tank is to..

options.text: restrict fuel movement in the tank.
prevent overpressure in the tank.
prevent mixture of the fuel and hydraulic fluid.
prevent the fuel from flowing in the vent lines.

qtL7pVdI.question: Fuel low level warnings usually provide the pilot with information regarding..

options.text: the level of fuel in the supply tanks.
the level of fuel in all tanks.

yUW1RUnk.question:
Refer to the Annex. Which of these statement about the fuel system are correct?
  1. If the AC fuel pumps are not running in the system configuration shown in the image, it is still possible to feed both engines from the main tanks.
  2. In the system configuration shown in the image the DC fuel system can supply fuel to the engines.

options.text: 1 is correct, 2 is incorrect
Both 1 and 2 are correct.
1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.
Both 1 and 2 are incorrect.

VLjN1Bq5.question: Which of the following is monitored by the flight crew for the aircraft fuel system?

options.text: Fuel temperature.
System pressure.
Vent tank overspill.

mchxtOVo.question: Which statement is true concerning the structure and possible advantage of an integral fuel tank?

options.text: It is built internally using the aircraft structure, this saves weight and space.
It is a separate metal container that is relatively cheap to manufacture.
It is constructed of rubber so it can be fitted into any free space within the aircraft.
It is a separate metal container that is relatively light weight.

Or8zYtQC.question:

1) Fuel pressure
2) Fuel temperature
3) Fuel density
4) Total fuel mass
5) Fuel flow
6) Fuel type
7) Total fuel used

87LTd5Hh.question: the main task of the fuel system is too?

options.text: Feed engines with fuel, allowing refuelling and defueling, isolate tanks, allow fuel dumping, optimization of centre of gravity
Feed engines with fuel, allowing refuelling and defueling, isolate tanks, allow fuel dumping, power in house electrical equipment
Feed engines with fuel, run ground supply units, move fuel for mass and balance purposes
Feed engines with fuel, heat up the aircraft, isolate tanks, allow fuel dumping

KlV0Hduo.question: The fuel tanks in small aircraft are mainly located

options.text: in the wings.
in the tail section of the aircraft.
close to the engine.

sI2RpUZL.question: Consider a turbine engine aeroplane, with two underwing engines, fitted with two wing tanks and one centre tank. If all centre tank fuel booster pumps fail:

options.text: Part or all of the fuel in the centre tank is considered unusable.

G6TKtGUw.question: Some aircraft are equipped with fuel tanks for trimming purpose, what's the position of those tanks

options.text: In the rear part of the aircraft, near the tail
On the wing tip

gjFjYEZX.question: Fuel pumps submerged in the fuel tanks of large multi-engine aircraft are typically:

options.text: centrifugal low pressure type pumps.
high pressure variable swash plate pumps.

KZrYeyBz.question: The ventilation system in a fuel tank

options.text: Prevents over pressure or excessive pressure in the tank
Allows air in to the fuel tank to keep it cool
Acts as an over fill drain pipe
Is where dump fuel is vented out of when required

8hHBhD5v.question: The fuel supply system on a jet engine includes a fuel heating device upstream of the main fuel filter so as to..

options.text: condition the fuel.
decrease the viscosity of the fuel so reducing the back pressure on the LP pumps.
enable the fuel to be used to warm the hydraulic fluid and engine oil via heat exchangers.
improve calorific content.

eVXySmdA.question: How is total fuel consumption calculated?

options.text: By integrating the rate of fuel consumption over an hour.
By differentiating the rate of fuel consumption over the flight time.

By dividing total distance flown by the volume of fuel used.

cc28fcZM.question:
Refer to figure. 
 Using the fuel schematic of a two-engined aeroplane, what is the location of the fuel cross-feed valve?

options.text: Item 2
Item 3
Item 1

options.text: Jet B, Jet A-1, Jet A.

Jet A, Jet A-1, Jet B.

R0S6Tgvg.question: When would the Fuel Low Level warning activate?

options.text: When the fuel is low in any tank that is not expected to empty during flight
When the fuel pump outlet pressure is low

V9rOikbC.question: The most appropriate statement concerning multi-engine jet aeroplane fuel systems, is

options.text: The fuel system may have provisions for heating the fuel before it enters the fuel filter.

zJgGGyZu.question: The function of a feed box in the fuel tank is to:

options.text: increase the fuel level at the boost pump location and prevent cavitation.

EGMDJBnN.question:
Which statement is correct?
 
1) The freezing point for Jet A is at a lower temperature than that for Jet B.
 
2) The flash point for Jet A is at a lower temperature than that for Jet B.

options.text: 1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is correct.
1) is correct, 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.

HYEFYlLQ.question: Using drip sticks, the quantity of fuel is determined by measurements

options.text: Drip sticks & data tables in the aircraft documentation
Dripsticks & current OAT
From the dripsticks and the fuel’s specific gravity

sometimes minimised by the incorporation of tank sump pads.
always the same quantity irrespective of aircraft attitude or flight conditions.
the amount of fuel not available for use but included on the fuel contents gauge.
fuel drained from the aircraft due to water contamination.

a deflection of the gauge to full.

A8hWKNp4.question: Refer to the Annex.  Given the system in the Annex, which of these statements about this fuel system is correct?

options.text: It is impossible to transfer fuel from the centre tank to the wing tanks.

2s7uUDPr.question: The SI unit of measurement for density is:

psi
bar

kFwsNuxk.question: The SI unit of measurement for density is:

options.text: kg/m^3^
psi.
kg/cm^2^
bar.

options.text: mineral
synthetic
castor

Ssfe9sFY.question: Consider a typical multi-cylinder piston engine with fuel injection. The central point for dividing the fuel to the individual cylinders...

options.text: is the fuel manifold valve.

ZRLMW38O.question: The use of too low octane gasoline in a piston engine would cause:

options.text: detonation.

IkhqBTKm.question: A piston engine may use a fuel of a different grade than the recommended

options.text: provided that the grade is higher

never
provided that it is an aeronautical petrol

qv8yNReZ.question: Vapour locking can lead to fuel starvation of the engine of large transport aeroplanes. Which limitation is commonly imposed by the Minimum Equipment List (MEL) in case of a complete failure of the engine boost pump?

options.text: A limitation on maximum operating altitude.

3fOuBvix.question: On a jet aeroplane, fuel heaters are located in the engines`..

ZJxjlz1u.question: Fuel flow information for gas turbine engines is:

786VEjyD.question: Concerning the fuel system high-pressure shut-off valve (HPSOV) of a gas turbine engine:

EQYpc3wI.question: What could happen if the center tank low-pressure fuel pumps have failed?

options.text: All, or parts of the fuel in the center tank are unusable.
